properties.Name: ShipmentChargeType
properties.Description:
A classification of shipment charges based on common characteristics or functions performed.

Ex:
- Abatement Charge
- Absorption Charge
- Accessorial Charge
- Advance Charge
- Agent Charge
- Broker Charge
- Brokerage Charge
- Cargo Agent Charge
- Cartage Agent Charge
- Cartage Charge
- COD Service Charge
- Collect Charge
- Co-Loader Charge
- Consolidation Charge
- Courier Charge
- Currency Adjustment Factor Charge (C.A.F.)
- Dealer Charge
- Delivery Charge
- Demurrage Charge
- Destination Delivery Charge (DDC)
- Detention Charge
- Drawback Charge
- Drayage Charge
- Duty Charge
- Equalization Charge
- Equipment Per Diem Charge
- Export Broker Charge
- Export Jobber Charge
- Freight Charge
- Freight Forwarding Charge
- Heavy Lift Charge
- Insurance Charge
- Loading Charge
- Pickup Charge
- Prepaid Charge
- Purchasing Agent Charge
- Shipper Agent Charge
- Storage Charge
- Surcharge
- Tax Charge
- Terminal Charge
- Transshipment Charge
- Unloading Charge
- Valuation Charge
- Warehousing Charge
 
where:

ABATEMENT CHARGE
A discount allowed for damage or overcharge in the  payment of a bill.

ABSORPTION CHARGE
One carrier assumes the  charges of another without any increase in charges to the  shipper.

ACCESSORIAL CHARGE
A charge for services provided by an airline in addition to the  normal transportation service. 

These charges are not included in the  basic weight rate charge. Common accessorial services include: advancement of charges, pick-up, delivery, C.O.D. service, signature service, storage, demurrage, and loading/unloading.

ADVANCE CHARGE
Transportation charge advanced by one carrier to another to be collected by the  later carrier from the  consignor or consignee.

AGENT CHARGE
A charge by an agent, which is an agent who distributes, represents, services or sells goods on behalf of sellers.

BROKER CHARGE
A charge paid to the  broker, who is a person or firm licensed by the  Customs Authorities to transact business with customs on behalf of importers for a fee. See Customshouse Brokers

BROKERAGE CHARGE
Freight forwarder/broker compensation as specified by ocean tariff or contract.

CARGO AGENT CHARGE
A charge by a cargo agent, who is an agent appointed by an airline to solicit and process international air freight for shipments.  Cargo agents are paid commissions by the  airline.

CARTAGE AGENT CHARGE
A charge paid to a cartage agent, who is a ground service operator who provides pickup and delivery in areas not served directly by air carrier.

Ground service operator who provides pick-up and delivery in areas not served directly by air carrier.

CARTAGE CHARGE
Cartage (Drayage) refers to local transport of goods and hauling of freight on carts, drays or trucks.

COD SERVICE CHARGE
A charge related to the  transportation service under which the  purchase price of the  goods in collected by the  carrier from the  receiver at the  time of delivery.  Payment Is subsequently transmitted to the  shipper.  Carriers charge a nominal fee for this service.  Payment is due upon delivery.  There are no credit provisions in COD service.

COLLECT CHARGE
The  transportation practice under which the  receiver of the  goods pays charges.  

Transportation charges may include pickup and/or delivery and are entered on the  air waybill to be collected from the  consigned.  Equivalent terms are "freight collect" or "charges forward."

CO-LOADER CHARGE
A charge by a co-loader, who assist in consolidation of shipments but is not the  master loader.

Each co-loader provides all the  documentation required for their shipment to the  master loader.

CONSOLIDATOR CHARGE
A charge paid to a Consolidator, which is an entity that provides consolidation services, joining multiple shipments into a single shipment for tender to an air carrier.  

An Air Freight Forwarder performs the  function of a consolidator.

An entity that provides service also provided by an air carrier, independent from that carrier, and derives income from package consolidation of others for tender to an air carrier. An Air Freight Forwarder also performs these functions.

COURIER CHARGE
A charge by a courier, who is an attendant who accompanies cargo shipment(s).  Also, attendant such as groom or veterinarian who accompany rare horses or other live animals.

CURRENCY ADJUSTMENT FACTOR CHARGE (C.A.F)
Currency Adjustment Factor. Surcharge percentage applied to freight rates to reflect currency fluctuations.

DEALER CHARGE
A charge by a dealer, which is a foreign-based business agent acting as an intermediary between a foreign exported and a homemarket importer.

DELIVERY CHARGE
A charge for the  delivery of a shipment from shipped/final ship-to location to the  consignee's address.

DEMURRAGE CHARGE
A variable fee charged to carriers and/or customers for the  use of carrier-owned ULD - Unit Load Devices beyond the  free-time allotment.

DESTINATION DELIVERY CHARGE
Abbreviation for "Destination Delivery Charge." A charge, based on container size, that is applied in many tariffs to cargo. This charge is considered accessorial and is added to the  base ocean freight. This charge covers crane lifts off the  vessel, drayage of the  container within the  terminal and gate fees at the  terminal operation.

DESTINATION DELIVERY CHARGE (DDC)
Destination Delivery Charges. A charge assessed by the  carrier for handling positioning of a full container.

DETENTION CHARGE
Charges raised for detaining container/trailer at customer's premises for longer period than provided in Tariff.

DRAWBACK CHARGE
A partial refund of an import fee. Refund usually results because goods are re-exported from the  country that collected the  fee.

DRAYAGE CHARGE
Charge made for local hauling by dray or truck.

This would be of primary application for air cargo freight re: intermodal transit of cargo.

DUTY CHARGE
A tax imposed on imports by the  customs authority of a country. Duties are generally based on the  value of goods, other factors such as weight or quantity limits, or a combination of value and other factors 

EQUALIZATION CHARGE
A monetary allowance to the  customer for picking up or delivering at a point other than the  destination shown on the  bill of lading. This provision is covered by tariff publication.

EQUIPMENT PER DIEM CHARGE
Per Diem A charge made by one transportation line against another for the  use of its equipment. The  charge is based on a fixed rate per day.

EXPORT BROKER CHARGE
A charge by an export broker, which is an individual or firm that brings together buyers and sellers for a fee, but does not take part in actual sales transactions.

EXPORT JOBBER CHARGE
A charge by an export jobber, who is an individual or firm bringing together buyers and sellers for a fee.

FREIGHT CHARGE
The  price paid to the  carrier for the  transportation of goods or merchandise by sea from one place to another.

FREIGHT FORWARDER CHARGE
A charge paid to an agent that handles the  routing and shipment and freight.

Air Freight Forwarder    A Service organization which serves the  dual role of air carrier (usually indirect) and shipper.  To the  shipper the  air freight forwarder is an indirect air carrier because it receives freight under its own tariff, yet does not actually operate the  airplanes.  The  air freight forwarder provides pick-up and delivery service to and from the  shippers dock, consolidates shipments into larger units, prepares shipping documentation and tenders shipments to the  airlines.  To the  airlines, the  air freight forwarder is a shipper.  Ordinarily an air freight forwarder is classed as an indirect air carrier, however, some air freight forwarders operate their own aircraft.

HEAVY LIFT CHARGE
A charge made for lifting articles too heavy to be lifted by a ship's normal tackle.

HEAVY LIFT CHARGE
A charge made for lifting articles of exceptional weight.

INSURANCE CHARGE
A charge for insuring a shipment.

LOADING CHARGE
A charge for the  loading of a shipment.

PICKUP CHARGE
An optional service for the  surface transport of shipments from shipper's dock to origination air terminal and from the  air terminal of destination to receiver's dock.  For airfreight, an additional charge is usually assessed.  It may be provide by an air freight forwarder, an integrated carrier, or by an independent truck operator either separately or under contract to an airline.

PREPAID CHARGE
The  transportation trade practice under which the  shipper pays transportation charges.

PURCHASING AGENT CHARGE
A charge by a purchasing agent for their services.   A purchasing agent purchases goods in their own country on behalf of foreign buyers such as government agencies or private businesses.

SHIPPER AGENT CHARGE
A charge paid to the  shipper agent.

STORAGE CHARGE
A charge for the  storage of a shipment not in a warehouse but in a temporary storage facility.

SURCHARGE
An extra or additional charge.

TAX CHARGE
A tax charge associated with a shipment.

Ex:
Airlines are responsible for the  collection of the  6.25% Federal U.S. Government Tax on Air Freight. The  tax applies to all forms of Intra-US cargo, i.e., freight, express, small package and mail that originates at one point and terminates at another within the  U.S., including Alaska and Hawaii. The  tax is applicable to the  basic weight rate, excess valuation charges and the  surcharge for transportation of Hazardous Materials.

TERMINAL CHARGE
A charge made for a service performed in a carrier's terminal area.

TRANSSHIPMENT CHARGE
A charge related to the  transfer of goods from one transportation line to another, or from one ship to another, or from one airline to another in order to complete a delivery .

UNLOADING CHARGE
A charge for the  unloading of a shipment.

VALUATION CHARGE
Charges assessed shippers who state a value of goods higher than the  assumed value by the  carrier.

WAREHOUSING CHARGE
A charge for the  warehousing or storage of a shipment.

Columns.Name: ShipmentChargeTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a shipment charge type.

Columns.Name: ShipmentChargeTypeName
Columns.Description: The name of the shipment charge type.

Columns.Name: ShipmentChargeTypeDescription
Columns.Description: The description of the shipment charge type.

Columns.Name: ShipmentChargeCategoryId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Shipment Charge Category.
